He has a one year lease for the space above Surgery Associates.


3.	Early Termination of Lease Due to Death or Disability:  Landlord agrees to terminate the Lease effective ninety (90) days after receiving written notice and copy of certificate of Edwin S. Chin death or Edwin S. Chin becomes Disabled.  For purposes of this section, “Disabled” shall mean the inability of Edwin S. Chin to perform his customary duties for a period of twelve (12) consecutive months.  In the event the Landlord disputes whether Edwin S. Chin is Disabled, Edwin S. Chin shall submit to examinations by two medical doctors, one selected by the Tenant and the other selected by the Landlord.  The two medical doctors shall examine Edwin S. Chin and determine whether it is more likely than not that Edwin S. Chin will be unable to perform his customary duties for a period of twelve (12) consecutive months from the date of the examination.  If the two medical doctors agree, their decision shall be binding and final.  If the two medical doctors disagree, they shall select a third doctor, whose determination shall be final and binding.  In the event this clause is exercised, Tenant agrees to forfeit their security deposit as part of the early Lease termination.

QUIET ENJOYMENT

Context:
3.    Early Termination of Lease Due to Death or Disability:  Landlord agrees to terminate the Lease effective ninety (90) days after receiving written notice and copy of certificate of Edwin S. Chin death or Edwin S. Chin becomes Disabled.  For purposes of this section, “Disabled” shall mean the inability of Edwin S. Chin to perform his customary duties for a period of twelve (12) consecutive months.  In the event the Landlord disputes whether Edwin S. Chin is Disabled, Edwin S. Chin shall submit to examinations by two medical doctors, one selected by the Tenant and the other selected by the Landlord.  The two medical doctors shall examine Edwin S. Chin and determine whether it is more likely than not that Edwin S. Chin will be unable to perform his customary duties for a period of twelve (12) consecutive months from the date of the examination.  If the two medial doctors agree, their decision shall be binding and final.  If the two medical doctors disagree, they shall select a third doctor, whose determination shall be final and binding.  In the event this clause is exercised, Tenant agrees to forfeit their security deposit as part of the early Lease termination.
QUIET ENJOYMENT

Lessor warrants that Lessee, upon discharge of all of Lessee’s obligations hereunder, shall and may be peaceably and quietly hold and enjoy the premises for the term of the Lease.

26. GROUND LEASE The Lessee acknowledges that the Lessor has entered into a Ground Lease for the property described in Exhibit A, and has constructed an office building on said property. All rights of Lessor are subject to that Ground Lease, and in the event of any dispute between the terms of this Lease and that of the Ground Lease, the Ground Lease shall control.

Daniel P Ziperovich MD

First Amendment to Lease

Highline Professional Building

The parties to this First Amendment to Lease dated the June 1, 2018, are Highline Professional Building Associates, Limited Partnership (“Landlord”) and Daniel P. Ziperovich, MD. an individual (“Tenant”).	

WHEREAS, Landlord and Tenant have a binding Lease Agreement dated June 1, 2018, together the lease in and to the premises described in Exhibit A Legal Description of the Property more commonly known as Highline Professional Building, 16122 8th, Avenue SW, Suite E-1, City of Seattle, County of King, State of Washington.

The parties do hereby mutually agree to modify certain particulars of the Lease Agreement as follow:

1.	Section 4 Term

Section 4 shall be modified as follows:

“The term of the Lease shall be extended three (2) years commencing June 1, 2021 and ending May 31, 2022.”

2.	Section 5 Rent.

	Monthly rent for the extended term of the Lease shall be as follows:
ESTOPPEL CERTIFICATES

At any time and from time to time, within thirty (30) days after notice of request by the Lessor, the Lessee shall execute, acknowledge, and deliver to the Lessee, or to such other recipients as the notice shall direct, a statement certifying that the Lease is unmodified and in full force and effect, or, if there have been modifications, that it is in full force and effect as modified in the manner specified in the statement. The statement shall also state the dates to which the rent and other charges have been paid in advance.

AUT OF P ES.

a) Corporate authority: if Lessee is a corporation, each individual executing this Lease on behalf of the corporation represents and warrants that he is duly authorized to execute this Lease in accordance with a duly adopted resolution of the Board of Directors of the corporation, and that this Lease is binding upon the corporation in accordance with its terms.
As a precondition to pursing any remedy for alleged default by the Lessee, the Lessor shall give notice of the default to the Lessee. Each notice of default shall specify the alleged event of default and the intended remedy. If the alleged default is non- payment of rent, taxes, or other sums to be paid by Lessee as provided in this Lease, the Lessee shall have ten (10) days after notice is given to cure the default. For the cure of any other default, the Lessee shall promptly and diligently after the notice is received begin curing the default and shall have thirty (30) days after notice is given, to complete the cure, plus any additional period that is reasonably required for the curing of the default. After expiration of the applicable time for curing a particular default, the Lessor may, at Lessor’s election, make any payment required of Lessee under this Lease, or perform or comply with any covenant or condition imposed on Lessee under this Lease. Any amount so paid or the cost of such performance, shall be deemed as additional rent payable by Lessee with the next succeeding installment of rent. No such act shall constitute a waiver of default or of any remedy for default or render Lessor liable for any loss or damage resulting from any such act.
